titleInfo.title: CONDEMNING VIOLENCE AGAINST PEACEFUL PROTESTERS OUTSIDE THE TURKISH AMBASSADOR'S RESIDENCE

extension.searchTitle: CONDEMNING VIOLENCE AGAINST PEACEFUL PROTESTERS OUTSIDE THE TURKISH AMBASSADOR'S RESIDENCE; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 96

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution, as amended, was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Condemning the violence against peaceful protesters outside the Turkish Ambassador's residence on May 16, 2017, and calling for the perpetrators to be brought to justice and measures to be taken to prevent similar incidents in the future
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Res. 354, amended, condemning the violence against peaceful protesters outside the Turkish Ambassador's residence on May 16, 2017, and calling for the perpetrators to be brought to justice and measures to be taken to prevent similar incidents in the future, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 397 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 286;

titleInfo.title: CONDEMNING TERRORIST ATTACKS IN MANCHESTER, UNITED KINGDOM

extension.searchTitle: CONDEMNING TERRORIST ATTACKS IN MANCHESTER, UNITED KINGDOM; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 96

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution, as amended, was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Condemning in the strongest terms the terrorist attacks in Manchester, United Kingdom, on May 22, 2017, expressing heartfelt condolences, and reaffirming unwavering support for the special relationship between our peoples and nations in the wake of these attacks
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.
